column1: '''''pêl''''' (plural ''peli'') is a [[Noldorin]] noun meaning "fenced field".<ref name="etym">{{LR|Etymologies}}
The word ''pêl'' or ''pel'' often appear as a suggested [[Neo-Elvish|Neo-Sindarin]] word
column4: [http://www.jrrvf.com/hisweloke/sindar/online/english.html Hiswelókë's Sindarin Dictionary] at [http://www.jrrvf.com/haut.shtml Jrrvf.com] (accessed 20 July 2011)</ref>

column1: Noldorin ''pêl'' is a descendant form of [[Kornoldorin|Old Noldorin]] ''pele''
column2: deriving from root [[PEL#Other versions|PEL(ES)]]. [[J.R.R. Tolkien|Tolkien]] also notes the word ''[[Wiktionary:tun#Old_English|tūn]]'' ("fenced field"; identified as [[Old English]] by [[Christopher Tolkien]]) in connection with ''pêl''.<ref name="etym"/>
